examples: Those pears aren't ripe enough for the children to eat (them).
You've worked enough ; rest for a bit.
We don't have long enough nails.

definitions.definition: Fully; quite; used after adjectives to express slight augmentation of the positive degree , and sometimes equivalent to very .
examples: He is ready enough to accept the offer.

definitions.definition: Used after certain adverbs to emphasise that a quality is notable, unexpected, etc.
examples: Talking of Mr Smith, funnily enough , I saw him just the other day.
I left my camera on the train, but luckily enough someone handed it in to lost property.

secondary_definitions: Fully; quite; used after adjectives to express slight augmentation of the positive degree , and sometimes equivalent to very .
Used after certain adverbs to emphasise that a quality is notable, unexpected, etc.
